jparsec.io.device

Interface GenericCamera

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CanonEOS40D50D1000D, VirtualCamera, WebcamCamera

    public interface GenericCamera
    An interface for the commands that should be available to all cameras. Current implementation is focused towards DSLR cameras, although a driver for CCDs could be written as well.
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  GenericCamera.CAMERA_MODEL
      The set of camera models supported.
      static class  GenericCamera.FILTER
      The set of filters supported.
      static class  GenericCamera.IMAGE_ID
      The set of image types supported.

      The set of possible (selectable) image IDs as names.

      The set of possible (all) image IDs as names.

      • shotAndDownload

        boolean shotAndDownload(boolean keepInCamera)
        Takes a shot from the camera and downloads it.
        Parameters:
        keepInCamera - True to keep a copy in the camera, false to remove it after download.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • isShooting

        boolean isShooting()
        Returns true if the camera is shooting now.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setCameraOrientation

        boolean setCameraOrientation(double ang)
        Sets the camera orientation respect the mount of the telescope. In case the telescope is in a equatorial mount, 0 means the camera/image 'up' direction is north (or south if the telescope inverts the image). This is used for the reduction pipeline later, the value set here should be as approximate as possible.
        Parameters:
        ang - Angle in radians, positive for clockwise rotation of the camera.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • getCameraOrientation

        double getCameraOrientation()
        Returns the camera orientation.
        Returns:
        Angle in radians.

      • setImageID

        boolean setImageID(GenericCamera.IMAGE_ID img)
        Sets the image identifier for the next frame.
        Parameters:
        img - Frame type.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • getImageID

        GenericCamera.IMAGE_ID getImageID()
        Returns the image identifier.
        Returns:
        Frame identifier.

      • getPathOfLastDownloadedImage

        java.lang.String getPathOfLastDownloadedImage()
        Returns the path of the last image downloaded. Specific implementation of this method could return the path of several files, in case more than one is created (jpg and cr2 in case of Canon cameras with JPG + RAW output mode). In this case all paths should be separated by comma.
        Returns:
        The path/s. Null in case of error when shooting last photo.

      • setDownloadDirectory

        boolean setDownloadDirectory(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the download directory for the images.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the directory.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • setFilter

        boolean setFilter(GenericCamera.FILTER filter)
        Sets the filter to use for the next frame. This method is intended to support filter wheels, although current implementation does not support it. It can be used to set if a DSLR camera has its default IR filter or not.
        Parameters:
        filter - The new filter.
        Returns:
        True if the command success.

      • getFilter

        GenericCamera.FILTER getFilter()
        Returns the filter currently in use.
        Returns:
        The filter.

        Sets the exposition time in seconds in bulb mode for DLSR cameras, or for CCD cameras.
        Parameters:

        Time in seconds.

      • getWidthHeightRatio

        double getWidthHeightRatio()
        Returns the ratio width/height from native camera resolution.
        Returns:
        The width/height ratio.

      • getInverseElectronicGain

        double getInverseElectronicGain()
        Returns the inverse electronic gain in e-/ADU, for the selected ISO.
        Returns:
        Inverse electronic gain, or 0 in case it is unknown.

      • getSaturationLevelADUs

        double getSaturationLevelADUs()
        Returns the saturation level in ADUs.
        Returns:
        Saturation level, or 0 if it is unknown.

      • getDepth

        int getDepth()
        Returns image depth in bits. 8 bits means a maximum intensity level of 255 in a pixel/color, usual in webcams. 14 is the usual value in modern DSLRs.
        Returns:
        Bits per pixel.

      • getFitsHeaderOfLastImage

        ImageHeaderElement[] getFitsHeaderOfLastImage()
        Returns a set of entries to construct the fits header for the last shot. The set of entries are quite basic and only contains those related to the properties of the shot, and not for the telescope or other hardware. Note typical value of width/height is 0 since the size of the image is not known until it is downloaded, so these values should be set later. The entries contains the following keys: 
         Entry    Value (typical)   Description
 --------------------------------------
 
 BITPIX      32             Bits per data value
 NAXIS        2             Dimensionality
 NAXIS1       0             Width
 NAXIS2       0             Height
 EXTEND       T             Extension permitted
 MAXCOUNT   255             Max counts per pixel
 ISO        100             ISO
 TIME         1             Exposure time in s
 MODE    jpg...             Resolution mode
 RAW      false             True for raw mode
 ANGLE        0             Camera orientation angle
 INSTRUME  name             Camera name
 CAM_MODE  VIRTUAL          Camera model (driver)
 APERTURE   2.8             Aperture f/
 DEPTH       14             Pixel depth in bits
 GAIN       2.8             Gain e-/ADU
 BULBTIME    60             Exposure time in bulb mode (s)
 MAXADU    4000             Saturation level in ADUs
 FILTER      IR             Filter name
 BAYER     RGBG             Bayer matrix, top-left and clockwise
 IMGID     Dark             Image id: Dark, Flat, On, Test, or Reduced
        Returns:
        The basic header to later create the fits file.

      • isBulb

        boolean isBulb()
        Returns true if the bulb position is set for this camera.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        void setMinimumIntervalBetweenShots(int seconds)
        Sets the minimum interval between shots for this camera. Default value is 0 so that consecutive shots will have minimum possible lag. Set to 30 or 60 seconds to allow the camera to get 'cooled'.
        Parameters:
        seconds - Time in seconds.

      • getMinimumIntervalBetweenShots

        int getMinimumIntervalBetweenShots()
        Returns the minimum interval of time allowed between shots. Default is 0.
        Returns:
        Time in seconds.
